elements.title: flag of Togo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the five stripes of the flag of Togo (pictured) represent the country's five regions?

elements.title: McLaren MCL60 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a commentator said the McLaren MCL60 underwent "one of the most impressive in-season development steps ever seen" in Formula One?

elements.title: Kanaria (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Kanaria's song "King" has been characterized as an allegory for the house arrest, trial, and execution of Louis XVI?

elements.title: Norman Hunter (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a schoolteacher tried to make left-footed footballer Norman Hunter play right-footed?

elements.title: Santos Passos Church (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Santos Passos Church in Guimarães, Portugal, was declared a royal chapel by King Luís I in 1878?

elements.title: Mammoth Solar (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the United States' largest planned solar project, Mammoth Solar, is named after mastodon fossils rather than its size?

elements.title: Hands on Me (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a lyric in the song "Hands on Me" is about Meghan Trainor being unable to have sex due to pelvic floor damage?

elements.title: William Hewett (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that William Hewett was the last-surviving British Army officer to have fought at the Battle of Waterloo?

elements.title: a 1938 Catholic procession (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a 1938 Catholic procession featured 80,000 marchers and one blimp?
